de.fraunhofer.iem.secucheck.InternalFluentTQL.catalog.LogInjectionAttack.CWE117

Class LogInjection

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • de.fraunhofer.iem.secucheck.InternalFluentTQL.catalog.LogInjectionAttack.CWE117.LogInjection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig

    public class LogInjection
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
    This class contains the example for Log-Injection. This example has been taken from the OWASP Log-Injection example.
    See Also:
    OWASP Log-Injection example, Serialized Form

        public LogInjection()

    • Method Detail

      • doGetWithoutSanitizer

        public void doGetWithoutSanitizer(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        This method authenticate the username and password. This method log everything and does not use sanitizer, therefore it contains Log-Injection.
        Parameters:
        request - HttpServlet request from the user.
        response - HttpServlet response to the user.

      • doGetWithSanitizer

        public void doGetWithSanitizer(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                               javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               org.owasp.esapi.errors.EncodingException
        This method authenticate the username and password. This method log everything and uses sanitizer, therefore it avoids Log-Injection.
        Parameters:
        request - HttpServlet request from the user.
        response - HttpServlet response to the user.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If fails to load ESAPI properties file.
        org.owasp.esapi.errors.EncodingException - If fails to encode the string to avoid Log-Injection.

      • sanitizeForLog

        public java.lang.String sanitizeForLog(java.lang.String user)
                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                       org.owasp.esapi.errors.EncodingException
        This method uses OWASP ESAPI to sanitize the user input for the URL. We have used encodeForURL, because it encodes next line carriage return that avoids the Log-Injection. Best solution for Log-Injection is input validation. See OWASP HTML-Sanitizer
        Parameters:
        user - Username
        Returns:
        Sanitized username.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If fails to load ESAPI properties file.
        org.owasp.esapi.errors.EncodingException - If fails to encode the string to avoid Log-Injection.
